Description.val:
FY 2021 funding includes $16.030M for Base Budget Requirements in support of the National Defense Strategy. 

This line item procures the initial issue of weapons, as well as the modernization, standardization and stock replenishment of a wide variety of Small Arms and weapons (caliber .50 and below) to meet Small Arms allowances and inventory objectives, including required gun mounts and associated support components. 

This line also provides sufficient types and quantities of weapons to support training, afloat security forces and shore missions of approximately 1,300 ship/ashore activities Navy-wide including the Naval Mobile Construction Battalions, Naval Construction Force Support Units, Construction Battalion Maintenance Units, Mobile Security Force, Marine Corps Security Force Battalion and Master at Arms. Quantities of weapons procured with the above funding are to meet Small Arms allowances and inventory objectives.

This line item also procures a range of weapons and small arms considered service common equipment for Naval Special Warfare (NSW) such as assault and sniper rifles, handguns, machine guns, mortar firing systems, and a variety of components including gun sights, gun mounts, combat and thermal optics and other related equipment. This funding supports the inventory objectives and service-common Small Arms allowances for NSW.

Justification.val: Funding of $16,030,000 in FY 2021 supports meeting Navy inventory objectives, including the M18 combat pistol, the M4A1 5.56mm combat rifle, the M500 shotgun, and the M2A1 .50 caliber heavy machine gun. Funding also supports Naval Special Warfare common inventory allowance and includes the Advanced Sniper Rifle (ASR, .300 PRC MRAD), M320A1 grenade launchers, M3E1 Carl Gustaf 84mm Recoilless Rifles, and the MK50MOD1 Stabilized Small Arms Mounts. Overall funding supports the procurement of M18, M4A1, M500, MK48, M2A1, M3E1, MK50MOD1 and CROWS II as well as the associated transportation and production engineering for US Navy small arms.
